title: Is the Dogri language losing resonance in India?

content: Unseasonal rains have devastated onion nurseries across Maharashtra, triggering indefinite farmer protests.

title: Tripura online activist held for “abusing” State govt.
content: Madhavi Biswas, a resident of Pratapgarh in Agartala, has spoken about alleged corruption in the State government and lack of civic amenities.

title: CPI Ministers to boycott Cabinet demanding withdrawal from PM SHRI pact
content: CPI general secretary D. Raja calls Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan’s reasons for joining the contentious scheme unconvincing.  Kerala government should have taken its cue from Tamil Nadu and moved the Supreme Court for unconditional and obligatory federal funding for education, he says

title: BJP hits out at Opposition over its stand on SIR 2.0
content: BJP national spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla alleged that Congress and other Opposition parties are targeting the Election Commission and using the SIR as an excuse for the “impending losses” in the coming polls

title: INDIA bloc to release poll manifesto on October 28; Rahul to join campaign
content: Rahul Gandhi to hold his first election campaign in Muzaffarpur and Darbhanga on October 29; Tejashwi slams the Central government and accuses it of “telling lies” about running special trains during Chhath

title: Congress high command will decide on changing Chief Minister, says Siddaramaiah
content: Amid speculation over the change of leadership and Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar’s visit to Delhi, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah in Mangaluru reiterated that the Congress high command will take a call on whether or not to continue him as the Chief Minister

title: Muhammad Yunus sparks controversy with controversial map on book presented to Pakistan military general
content: The map in question was printed on the cover of a book that was presented to Chairman of Pakistan’s Joint Chiefs of Staff Committee (CJCSC) General Sahir Shamshad Mirza

title: Experts link fatal mudslip to poor road stability measures in Idukki
content: Experts blame unscientific slope cutting practices for landslips on the the Kochi-Dhanushkodi stretch.

title: Trinamool softens stand on SIR, says will democratically protest if genuine voters are removed
content: The CPI(M) urged transparency in Special Intensive Revision of voter lists, whereas the Congress sought that all-party meetings be convened both at the State and Central level

title: Only God will do justice, says father of Bihar youth jailed for abusing PM during Rahul Gandhi’s Voter Adhikar Yatra
content: Mohammed Rizvi’s only crime is his poor family background, he had been coaxed into committing the mistake, says his father, who runs a small two-wheeler repair shop at Bharwara village; he says the police haven’t given him a copy of the FIR and he lacks the resources to hire a lawyer for his son

title: Odisha deploys disaster response forces to tackle Cyclone Montha
content: All district administrations have been asked to ensure ‘zero casualty’ in the natural disaster, said Suresh Pujari, State Revenue and Disaster Management Minister

title: Chetan and Ajit carry family legacies into Bihar battle
content: Two candidates from the Rajput community have distinct profiles – while one is battling the legacy of a ‘don’, the other is following the footsteps of a man who has never compromised on his ideology

title: Cyclone set to cross coast; red alert in 16 A.P. districts
content: Cyclonic storm Montha is very likely to cross Andhra Pradesh coast between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam around Kakinada in the evening or night of Oct.28 as a severe cyclonic storm with a maximum sustained wind speed of 90-100 kmph, says IMD; Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu directs officials to ensure that relief reaches the public without delay

title: Voters in rural Bihar still reluctant to rally behind ‘untested’ Jan Suraaj
content: From distrust to disinterest, JSP struggles with low recall and credibility in the State’s hinterlands. However, urban voters who have grievances with the current government but are uncomfortable voting for the Tejashwi Yadav-led Grand Alliance, do see Prashant Kishor’s party as an alternative

title: Black hole activities suppress the birth of new stars around it: Study
content: ‘It reveals that both intense radiation from around the black holes as well as the high-speed jets they emit can work together to eject gas from the centres of galaxies, potentially shutting down star formation in their central regions and regulating galactic growth.

title: T.N. will fight any attempt to disenfranchise its people, says Chief Minister M.K. Stalin
content: DMK and its allies have called for an all-party meeting on the SIR of electoral rolls on November 2. The leaders alleged that the functioning of the EC was not only controversial but also suspicious

title: Digital arrest is one of the most dreaded threats to citizens: President Murmu
content: Addressing Indian Police Service probationers, the President referred to the growing trend of fraudsters impersonating law enforcement officers, and extorting money by threatening victims with arrest or the freezing of bank accounts

title: Election Commission modifies some SIR rules after Bihar
content: No documents are to be collected from electors during the Enumeration Phase, the ECI said in a notice issued to the Chief Electoral Officers of the 12 States and Union Territories where the SIR will be carried out next

title: In Delhi Acid Attack Case, "Toilet Cleaner" Twist And A Huge Confession
content: The woman's father has now been detained by the Delhi Police for masterminding the fake acid story to frame the three men. He has confessed that he plotted the whole conspiracy, said the Delhi Police.

title: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta Takes Part In Chhath Puja Celebrations At Yamuna Ghat
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta joined scores of devotees in offering Arghya' to the rising Sun along the banks of the Yamuna River on the concluding day of Chhath Puja on Tuesday.

title: "Acts Were Consensual": Court Cancels Rape Case Against 23-Year-Old Man
content: The Karnataka High Court has quashed an FIR against a 23-year-old man accused of raping a woman he met on a dating app, observing that a relationship entered into by mutual consent cannot be converted into a criminal offence except in the "clearest o

title: Ex-Metaverse Vice President Vishal Shah Gets Key AI Role
content: Vishal Shah was in charge of product management for Instagram at Meta for over six years before becoming vice president of Metaverse.

title: "Anything I Can Do": Trump Promises Full Support To "Strongest Ally" Japan
content: Trump called Sanae Takaichi's role as Japan's first woman prime minister as a "big deal," putting an emphasis on the US commitment to Japan.

title: UP Teen Dies By Suicide After Family Scolds Her Over Studies, Chores
content: A 15-year-old girl allegedly hanged herself at her home here after she was scolded by family members over studies and chores, police said on Monday.

title: Supreme Court Rejects Centre's Plea Against Order To Implement MGNREGA In Bengal
content: The Supreme Court on Monday dismissed the Centre's plea challenging the Calcutta High Court order which directed that MGNREGA, the 100-day job guarantee scheme, be implemented prospectively in West Bengal from August 1, 2025.

title: Trump Says He "Would Love To" Run For Third Presidential Term
content: US President Donald Trump has kept the possibility of running for a third presidential term in 2028 open.

title: Cyclone Montha Moving Towards Andhra Coast, Landfall This Evening: 10 Points
content: Cyclonic storm "Montha" is moving steadily towards the Andhra Pradesh coast and is expected to make landfall near Kakinada between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam on Tuesday evening.

title: Pune Techie Arrested By Anti-Terrorism Squad For Alleged Links With Al Qaeda
content: A software engineer was arrested by Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) in Pune on Monday for his alleged links with banned organisations like Pakistan's Al Qaeda and role in radicalising youth, an official said.

title: Live Updates: Cyclone Montha To Cross Andhra Coast Today, Heavy Rain Expected
content: Cyclone Montha is expected to cross the Andhra Pradesh coast between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam around Kakinada during Tuesday evening or night as a severe cyclonic storm.

title: Lawrence Bishnoi Gang Member Jagdeep Singh Alias Jagga Arrested In US
content: In a major breakthrough, Rajasthan's Anti-Gangster Task Force (AGTF) has confirmed the arrest of gangster Jagdeep Singh alias Jagga, an active member of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, in the US.

title: Man Accused Of Killing Ex-Japan PM Shinzo Abe To Go On Trial Today
content: A man accused of fatally shooting former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is set to go on trial on Tuesday, three years after the assassination of Japan's longest-serving premier stunned a nation where gun crime and political violence are rare.

title: Trump's "Nuclear Submarine" Warning To Putin After Big Cruise Missile Test
content: US President Donald Trump has called Russia's nuclear-powered Burevestnik cruise missile test "inappropriate" and advised Russian President Vladimir Putin to focus on ending the conflict with Ukraine.

title: No SIR, FIR Will Work If People Turn Against You: Prashant Kishor Slams BJP
content: Jan Suraaj founder Prashant Kishor on Monday took a swipe at the BJP-led central government over the EC's announcement of the 2nd phase of Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls across 12 States and Union Territories.

title: Amazon To Lay Off 30,000 Corporate Employees In Largest Job Cut Since 2022: Report
content: Amazon is planning to cut as many as 30,000 corporate jobs beginning on Tuesday, as the company pares expenses and compensates for overhiring during the peak demand of the pandemic, according to three people familiar with the matter.

title: US B-1B Bombers Fly Off Coast Of Venezuela Amid Rising Tensions: Report
content: A pair of B-1B bombers flew over the Caribbean Sea off the coast of Venezuela on Monday, flight tracking data showed, in the third such show of force by US military aircraft in recent weeks.

title: Fear Of Mass Destruction In Jamaica As Hurricane Melissa Nears Island
content: Brutal winds and heavy rains lashed Jamaica on Monday ahead of Hurricane Melissa unleashing what the prime minister warned could be a massively destructive storm -- the island's most violent on record.

title: India, Sri Lanka Discuss New Ferry Route Between Rameswaram, Talaimannar
content: The Minister of Ports, Shipping and Waterways, Sarbananda Sonowal, held a bilateral meeting with Sri Lanka's Ports and Civil Aviation Minister, Anura Karunathilake, during the India Maritime Week 2025 in Mumbai.

title: Hamas Returns Hostage Body As Families Urge Pause To Gaza Truce
content: Hamas handed over the remains of a deceased hostage on Monday as the Palestinian group came under increasing pressure to return its remaining deceased captives as promised under the Gaza ceasefire.

title: Navy’s top maritime forum, the Indo-Pacific Regional Dialogue 2025, opens today
content: The IPRD 2025 aims to strengthen multilateral cooperation, promote regional stability, and advance the shared vision of a resilient and prosperous Indo-Pacific

title: Japanese PM Takaichi faces her first big diplomatic test with Trump talks
content: The meeting will be watched closely in Delhi for any clarity between the two leaders on India’s plans to host the delayed Quad summit; the visit to Japan comes just before Trump’s meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping in South Korea

title: Well-prepared for SIR in Kerala, says Kelkar
content: Steps being taken to avoid ‘dual duty’ trouble for officers as SIR coincides with 2025 local body polls, says Rathan Kelkar

title: Chief Information Commissioner appointments in 'two or three' weeks, Centre tells SC
content: “The best way to kill the RTI is to not make any appointments… If they do make appointments, they select persons out of the blue. Names are just air-dropped. There is no information on who is being appointed,” said Prashant Bhushan.

title: SC raps Delhi police for delay in filing response to bail pleas of 2020 riots accused
content: The top court said most of the accused in the larger 2020 Delhi riots conspiracy case have already spent nearly five years in custody

title: IRCTC scam case: Lalu Yadav, Rabri Devi ask Delhi court not to conduct day-to-day trial
content: Say day-to-day hearings are happening in three other cases and ask for time to read the chargesheet and court order

title: CM okays land for railway coaching terminals at Amaravati, Gannavaram
content: Chandrababu Naidu orders immediate release of ₹27 crore for next phase of work on new Nadikudi-Srikalahasti railway line, moots Integrated Logistics Park, high-speed elevated railway corridors on Hyderabad-Bengaluru and Hyderabad-Chennai routes via Amaravati

title: Fill vacant posts in agricultural institutes, Chouhan tells ICAR, States
content: The Union Minister stressed the need to develop agriculture-related educational infrastructure and enable self-reliance

title: Three-day national conference of school boards in Hyderabad from Oct. 29
content: Delegates ranging from chairpersons of school boards and policy experts, to representatives from international affiliates such as Cambridge and the International Baccalaureate (IB) will be present to share knowledge on assessment reforms, quality assurance, skill education and digital learning ecosystems

title: Willing to work, even without pay, during monsoon, protesting conservancy workers tell Madras High Court
content: They say they are making the unconditional and voluntary offer as a gesture of goodwill and in the interest of the residents of Chennai

title: Great Nicobar Island Project: over 70 experts, scientists write to Environment Minister on ‘grave’, irreversible’ impact
content: The letter, made public and sent to Bhupender Yadav’s office as well, was in response to the Environment Minister’s article in The Hindu last month, in which he defended the project

title: CCB busts international cybercrime racket, arrests two
content: The accused had hacked into the accounts of a private firm and transferred ₹47 crore within two and a half hours on October 6

title: Omar Abdullah calls out cross-voters, ‘destruction of votes’ in J&K Rajya Sabha election
content: The issue of cross-voting gripped the J&K Assembly on Monday as members of the ruling alliance raised slogans of ‘vote chori’ (stealing)

title: 47 schools in Kerala had zero students in 2024-25: Union Ministry data
content: These schools also had 19 teachers to teach students. None of these schools are in the government sector, clarifies Samagra Shiksha Kerala

title: Srisailam wears festive look on first Monday of ’Karthika Masam’
content: The temple pond, Pushkarini, was lit up with 1 lakh lamps as part of ’Laksha Deepotsavam’, while ‘Pushkarini Harathi’ was performed on the occasion

title: Cricket fever grips Karimnagar as district hosts first official HCA league matches
content: Karimnagar earned the unique distinction of being the first district in Telangana to host the official A-Level HCA League matches outside Hyderabad

title: Shadow of Sabarimala looms large as Pandalam prepares for another poll battle
content: BJP, seeking a second straight term, exudes confidence.  Determined to widen its successful strategy of combining Hindu and Christian voters and stamp Pandalam as a ‘saffron fort,’ the party has already completed groundwork.  Riding on council’s administrative lapses, LDF plans to corner BJP over its governance record. UDF is also attempting a comeback attempt, riding on the  Sabarimala sentiment. Its “faith protection marches” culminated in a grand show of strength here

title: Hospital retrieves man’s body from home after it forgets to do autopsy
content: Hospital officials say they forgot to conduct post-mortem examination thinking that it was a natural death as he died after a month’s treatment

title: Tenant farmers reel under steep lease rates, lack of support in Andhra Pradesh: survey
content: A.P. Tenant Farmers’ Union study across all 26 districts finds most cultivators landless, uninsured, and excluded from crop registration and credit access

title: Karnataka coffee growers welcome Modi’s praise, seek action on long-pending challenges
content: In his monthly radio broadcast, Modi lauded the distinctive character and diversity of Indian coffee, saying it has carved a ‘unique identity’ on the world stage

title: Punnapra-Vayalar uprising served as inspiration for future struggles: Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan inaugurates the valedictory function of  anniversary of the Punnapra-Vayalar uprising at Vayalar.

title: Chief Secretary directs power utilities to stay on high alert for Cyclone Montha
content: Vijayanand reviews readiness of Genco, Transco and DISCOMs; calls for seamless coordination and quick power restoration in coastal areas

content: Amit Shah outlines plans for shipping sector at India Maritime Week; 680 MoUs worth ₹10 lakh crore likely to be signed

title: Delhi to bar entry of non-BS-VI compliant vehicles registered outside city from Nov. 1
content: Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) approved a sweeping ban on the entry of polluting commercial vehicles into Delhi from November 1, amid the city's pollution woes.

title: Naidu orders coastal evacuations, vows zero casualties as Cyclone Montha nears
content: State government steps up preparedness with real-time monitoring, relief centres, and preventive measures in vulnerable regions under the Chief Minister’s directives

title: Sources: Broncos CB Surtain expected out weeks
content: Broncos cornerback Pat Surtain II is expected to miss multiple games with a left pectoral strain and could be a candidate for injured reserve, sources told ESPN on Monday.

title: Michigan, Moore drop appeals in infractions case
content: In the past month, both the University of Michigan and Wolverines head football coach Sherrone Moore withdrew their appeals in the NCAA infractions case centered on advance scouting, according to the NCAA's Division I Infractions Dashboard.

title: Kay's ex-wife: Saw pills passed on Angels' plane
content: The ex-wife of former Angels employee Eric Kay testified she saw players and team employees passing around pills on the team plane, and that the team was aware of his drug use.

title: Fan at Pens game injured in fall from upper level
content: A fan at Monday night's game between the Penguins and Blues was taken to a hospital after falling from the upper concourse at PPG Paints Arena.

title: Ravens expect QB Jackson to start Thu. at Miami
content: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson is expected to return from a hamstring injury and start Thursday night's game at Miami, coach John Harbaugh said Monday.

title: Pacers to sign dunk champ McClung, cut Wiseman
content: The Indiana Pacers are signing three-time dunk contest champion Mac McClung to a standard NBA deal. They plan to cut James Wiseman to create room.

title: Ex-NFL star Peterson still in jail after DWI arrest
content: Former NFL running back Adrian Peterson remained jailed on Monday after being arrested a day earlier in a Houston suburb on charges of driving while intoxicated and unlawfully carrying a weapon.

title: 🏈 Top NFL players who could be traded
content: Here's how the top trade candidates -- including Trey Hendrickson, Chris Olave and even Mark Andrews -- stack up. Who is the top target to land before Nov. 4?

title: Sports' mafia ties run deeper than NBA gambling scandal
content: Prosecutors say two former NBA players played in rigged poker games run by mob members. Organized crime has long exploited athletes' vulnerabilities.

content: Ten of Sunday's games were two-score wins -- not super exciting. But we still found something fun in every matchup, including some RB takeovers.

content: We sized up Week 8 overreactions, including fantasy. Is Fields on more solid ground? Will Garrett be the DPOY?

content: Wentz proved to be a warrior, playing through a serious injury, but now it's time to see what McCarthy can do.

content: Brian Kelly is out at LSU, adding to what is already a busy college football coaching carousel. Here are the jobs we think are best and why.

content: After nine weeks of twists and turns, these teams are at the head of the class -- at least for the time being.

title: Real Madrid enjoy statement Clásico win; Liverpool lose again; more
content: Sunday's Clasico was a blockbuster, though Barca may regret sending Lamine Yamal out pre-game to rile up Madrid. PLUS: What Liverpool's fourth straight league loss means, drama for Inter at Napoli, and more.

content: Mondays in October have had some of the best betting action all year, and now the NBA enters the mix.

title: World Series and MNF, plus NBA, NHL and more showdowns
content: Celebrate the sports equinox with the World Series, 'Monday Night Football,' NBA and NHL as the headliners.

content: The Hawks had a busy offseason that included surrounding Young with star power. Can he claim the wide-open East and prove he's worth a max deal?

content: Which NBA players are primed to take the next step in their development? Jeremy Woo predicts the top five.

content: The top-2 FCS teams, and winners of 12 of the past 14 national titles, met in one of the country's fiercest rivalries.

content: Highlighting available free agent options after a weekend of surprising performances ahead of Week 9.

content: What lines offered immediate value once odds came out? Here are four early bets and a futures wager to track.

content: Sportsbooks are slowly taking notice of BYU, Georgia Tech and Navy, but what's the best strategy to bet them?

content: Could Ty Simpson be the QB1? Is Anthony Hill Jr. climbing the LB ranks again? We have notes on NFL prospects through CFB Week 9.

title: Two F's and an incomplete make for a woeful UFC 321 report card
content: Following a disappointing ending during the main event between Tom Aspinall and Ciryl Gane at UFC 321, Andreas Hale gives a letter grade for every fight on the card.

title: Next Brit up: Could Fabio Wardley actually beat Oleksandr Usyk?
content: Fabio Wardley called Oleksandr Usyk out after his win over Joseph Parker. Will the fight actually happen? And can Wardley win?

title: How Norris rediscovered F1 title 'favorite' tag in Mexico
content: Lando Norris hasn't been F1's title favorite for some time, but his Mexico win puts him atop the standings.

title: Moultrie & Co. get Hayes' team back playing 'the USA way'
content: For a team that prides itself on playing "the USA way," Sunday's 3-1 win over Portugal was a good response to Thursday's shock loss.

title: Why everyone is talking about Bayern's Lennart Karl
content: Bayern Munich forward Lennart Karl has caught the eye after some fine performances this season. Here's everything you need to know.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Juventus eye move for Chelsea's Gusto
content: Juventus are reportedly looking to add to their defensive depth signing Chelsea's Malo Gusto. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Pickups: Go get Egor Demin, Herbert Jones, Walter Clayton Jr.
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Cyclone Montha: Storm set to hit Andhra coast tonight; Odisha, TN brace for heavy rain
content: Cyclonic storm Montha is set to make landfall near Kakinada, Andhra Pradesh, with wind speeds reaching 100 kmph. Coastal districts are on high alert, with relief centers established and evacuation efforts underway, including pregnant women. Neighboring Odisha and Tamil Nadu are also bracing for heavy rainfall and strong winds as the storm progresses.

title: 'Wanted in many cases': Notorious Bishnoi gang member held in US; was under radar for long
content: Rajasthan's anti-gangster task force, in collaboration with US Immigration and Customs Enforcement, detained Jagdeep Singh, alias Jagga, a key operative of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, near the US-Canada border. Jagga is wanted in over a dozen cases in Rajasthan and Punjab for serious criminal activities, including attempted murder.

title: Shreyas Iyer update from Sydney: Why he was rushed to ICU, and family travel plan
content: Team India's Shreyas Iyer is in Sydney's ICU after a severe fall during an ODI match. A splenic rupture caused dangerous internal bleeding, prompting an emergency hospital admission. Iyer is recovering well, with the BCCI closely monitoring his condition and arranging for family to join him.

title: ‘Golden Age’: US, Japan sign agreement on 'securing' supply of rare earths — message to Xi?
content: The United States and Japan have signed a critical minerals and rare earths deal, aiming to reduce dependence on China. This agreement, part of a broader Indo-Pacific strategy, signals a coordinated effort to diversify supply chains and bolster alliances amid global resource competition. The pact underscores a commitment to strengthening bilateral relations and enhancing economic security.

title: Amazon may lay off 30,000 employees in largest job cut in the company’s history
content: Amazon is reportedly gearing up for massive job cuts, potentially eliminating up to 30,000 corporate roles starting this week. This significant reduction, impacting divisions like HR, Operations, and AWS, aims to curb expenses and streamline bureaucracy under CEO Andy Jassy's efficiency drive. The move follows aggressive pandemic-era hiring and a push for employees to return to office.

title: IND vs AUS: 'Rohit Sharma will retire after 2027 World Cup,' says childhood coach
content: Rohit Sharma's childhood coach, Dinesh Lad, revealed the star opener plans to retire after the 2027 ODI World Cup. This comes after Sharma's match-winning century against Australia. Lad also praised Virat Kohli's resilience, noting their progress towards Sachin Tendulkar's records. Both players are now set for the upcoming series against South Africa.

title: Magnitude 6.1 earthquake hits western Turkey; buildings collapse
content: A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck western Turkey, causing three previously damaged buildings to collapse in Sindirgi, Balikesir province. The tremor, felt across multiple provinces, injured 22 people, primarily from panic-related falls. Authorities provided shelter for residents fearing aftershocks, as the region continues to experience seismic activity.

title: How a Rs 20 samosa habit can lead to a Rs 3 lakh angioplasty: Doctor warns of real cost
content: A Delhi cardiologist's viral post highlights how daily Rs 20 samosas can lead to a Rs 3 lakh angioplasty, urging preventive health.  He explains that small, unhealthy choices accumulate, causing long-term heart damage and significant financial strain.  The message resonates with working professionals, emphasizing that proactive healthy habits are far more cost-effective than future medical interventions.

title: M&S ends contract with TCS after cyberattack: TCS issues clarification
content: TCS has denied reports claiming Marks & Spencer terminated their contract following a £300 million cyberattack. The IT firm stated the report contained factual inaccuracies and that it does not provide cybersecurity services to M&S. TCS clarified that their service desk contract with M&S concluded prior to the April 2025 cyber incident through a competitive RFP process.

title: Tariff row: China warns against 'law of jungle' ahead of Trump–Xi meet; wants 'free trade system'
content: Chinese Premier Li Qiang warned against rising unilateralism and protectionism in global trade at the ASEAN Summit, urging nations to support free trade. His remarks precede a crucial meeting between US President Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping, where both leaders are expected to discuss easing ongoing trade disputes and averting further tariffs.

title: Pipe down, Surya! India need runs from their captain, not punchlines
content: Since taking charge as India’s T20I captain, Suryakumar Yadav’s form has nosedived even as his off-field antics grab headlines. Despite Gautam Gambhir’s public backing, Surya’s prolonged lean patch -- 100 runs in 11 innings this year — raises concerns ahead of the T20 World Cup. His words may entertain, but India need runs, not rhetoric, from their skipper.

title: Turn off that phone: Ex-Google CEO's advice; 3 habits for success
content: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt credits his success not to endless work but to mindful reflection. Inspired by mentor Bill Campbell, he spends weekends offline, writing and planning without screens. Schmidt says this habit fosters clarity and focus, proving that real productivity comes from strategic thinking, not longer hours, and that sometimes, success starts by switching off.

title: GM layoffs: Engineers fired on Microsoft Teams; Says it's business, not you
content: General Motors has let go of over 200 salaried employees, mainly CAD engineers, at its Michigan tech campus. This move, part of a restructuring to boost profits, follows strong third-quarter earnings and a raised financial outlook. GM stated the layoffs target execution roles to enhance core design capabilities. This comes as the automotive sector sees broader workforce reductions.

title: Pan-India SIR announced: No need for documents at enumeration stage; to begin on Nov 4
content: The Election Commission has altered norms for the pan-India Special Summary Revision (SIR), eliminating document submission at the enumeration stage. Electors not linked to previous SIR will receive notices to prove citizenship, with Aadhaar accepted solely as identity proof. The process, spanning 103 days, will see concurrent notice, enumeration form decision, and claims/objections handling.

title: Brittany Mahomes stuns in red outfit at Chiefs game, stealing Patrick’s spotlight
content: Brittany Mahomes is making a significant impact this NFL season, both with her bold fashion choices and her community involvement.  She recently wowed fans with a striking fire-red leather outfit, showcasing her growing influence beyond her husband Patrick's football career.  Together, the couple continues to give back to Kansas City through their foundation and sports team ownership.

title: 'Possessed al-Qaida literature': Pune techie arrested; laptops, phones seized
content: A software engineer, Zubair Hangargekar, was arrested in Pune by the Maharashtra ATS for possessing al-Qaida literature. The arrest followed searches where his laptop was found with downloaded material from the banned terrorist group. Authorities are investigating his potential links to al-Qaida members and other extremist organizations.

title: 'Hitman' back home! Rohit Sharma mobbed by fans in Mumbai after unforgettable Aus tour
content: Rohit Sharma received a hero's welcome in Mumbai after a stellar ODI series in Australia. The veteran batsman's impressive form, including a century in Sydney, has reaffirmed his class and potential for the 2027 World Cup. Head coach Gautam Gambhir lauded his crucial contributions, highlighting his ability to finish games.

title: $20 billion goods in 10 years: How Amazon amplified Indian sellers' global reach; US on top
content: Indian sellers on Amazon have achieved over $20 billion in cumulative e-commerce exports since 2015. The e-tail giant aims to reach $80 billion in exports by 2030, driven by increasing global demand and a growing number of small and medium businesses leveraging digital platforms to go global.

title: CIC appointment: SC rejects pleas to make names public; govt to shortlist in 3 weeks
content: The Supreme Court deferred pleas to make shortlisted candidates for information commissioner posts public, as the Centre expects to finalize selections within three weeks. While assuring scrutiny of appointments, the court cited potential litigation if shortlisted names were revealed, urging prompt action on state-level vacancies.

title: 112 drug samples failed quality test in Sept; 49 from Himachal Pradesh alone - CDSCO report
content: Following tragic child deaths, a nationwide quality check revealed 112 drug samples failed tests, with Himachal alone accounting for 49. Two Himachal-manufactured cough syrups, along with others from Uttarakhand and Chhattisgarh, were flagged for not meeting standards or being spurious. This highlights critical quality control issues in the pharmaceutical sector.

title: 'Losing hope': Omar Abdullah on J&K statehood restoration; refuses to speak on future as CM
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah admitted his optimism for statehood restoration is fading, citing delays as a hurdle for the elected government. He also addressed internal party criticism and asserted the National Conference's opposition to the BJP in the region.

title: MLB rumors: Dodgers target $400M Tigers star to join Ohtani, Snell
content: The Los Angeles Dodgers are reportedly eyeing a blockbuster trade for Detroit Tigers ace Tarik Skubal, potentially forming an unprecedented pitching rotation with Blake Snell and Shohei Ohtani. With contract negotiations stalled and a significant financial gap, the Tigers may opt to trade Skubal, who is projected to command a record-breaking deal.

title: 734 acres institutional lands resumed and transferred to MRDCL
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Big relief: H-4 visa holders keep right to work in US - will Trump change it?
content: The US Supreme Court has ended a decade-long legal fight, allowing H-4 visa holders, primarily spouses of H-1B workers, to continue working. This decision upholds employment authorization for those facing green card backlogs.

title: How did Cody “Beef” Franke die? Inside Barstool star’s tragic death
content: Cody "Beef" Franke, a beloved personality on Barstool Sports' Fore Play golf podcast, has tragically passed away at 31 following a sudden medical event. Known for his infectious humor and passion for golf, Franke was a former PGA professional who joined Barstool in 2025.

title: MAGA wants Mamdani out: Zohran's US citizenship under scanner; 'anti-American' remarks draw ire
content: Prominent MAGA Republicans are demanding the DOJ investigate New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani, seeking to revoke his citizenship and deport him. They cite alleged undisclosed affiliations with the Democratic Socialists of America and past remarks.

title: Joe Alwyn slammed as old video with Taylor Swift goes viral amid Kelce praise
content: Taylor Swift's upcoming wedding to Travis Kelce has fans buzzing, especially after a resurfaced clip from 2022 showing her with ex Joe Alwyn sparked outrage.  Fans criticized Alwyn's apparent rush to avoid paparazzi, contrasting it with Kelce's public support for Swift's success.  The couple remains private about their wedding details.

title: Is Jayden Daniels playing tonight vs Chiefs? Washington QB injury update
content: Jayden Daniels, the Commanders' dynamic quarterback, is sidelined tonight against the Chiefs due to a hamstring injury sustained last week. This setback follows a previous knee issue. Veteran Marcus Mariota will start, with Washington targeting Week 9 for Daniels' potential return. Keeping their young star healthy is crucial for the team's season.

title: Cardi B opens up on emotional toll of motherhood before baby with Stefon Diggs
content: Cardi B is expecting her fourth child with Stefon Diggs and recently shared her struggles with breastfeeding, which made her feel "less of a woman." She advocates for mothers using formula, emphasizing that feeding a child is paramount. Cardi B has consistently spoken out against judging mothers' choices regarding feeding methods.

title: Bank locker holding seized jewellery worth Rs 90 lakh disappears; Allahabad HC seeks pay-out
content: A taxpayer whose gold jewellery, seized by Income Tax authorities and stored in a bank locker, was stolen, has won a compensation case. The Allahabad High Court ruled that the Income Tax Department is responsible for the loss and must compensate the petitioner.

title: 'Worth over Rs 25 crore': Drugs dropped from Pak drones in Jammu; seized by BSF
content: BSF troops in Jammu's RS Pura sector seized over 5.3kg of heroin, valued at Rs 25 crore, believed to be dropped by a Pakistani drone. This seizure highlights ongoing efforts by Pakistan-based smugglers to infiltrate narcotics into India, with recent arrests in Kathua uncovering a wider syndicate.

title: Pancreas health: 5 warning signs, causes and prevention tips
content: Your pancreas, crucial for digestion and blood sugar, can signal distress through persistent abdominal pain, unexplained weight loss, nausea, blood sugar imbalance, and jaundice. These early warnings, often overlooked, necessitate prompt medical attention to prevent serious conditions like pancreatitis or diabetes. Lifestyle choices like limiting alcohol and maintaining a balanced diet are key to pancreatic health.

title: World’s first AI minister: 'Diella' to give birth to 83 ‘AI children’
content: Albania's Prime Minister Edi Rama announced their AI minister, Diella, is 'pregnant' with 83 digital 'offspring.' These AI assistants will aid Socialist Party MPs, enhancing parliamentary efficiency and transparency. Diella, the world's first AI minister, was appointed to combat corruption in government tenders, marking a significant step in integrating AI into governance.

title: Racial hate crime: Indian-origin woman raped in UK; 32-yr-old ‘white male’ held
content: A 32-year-old man was arrested following a manhunt after an alleged racially aggravated rape of a 20-year-old Indian-origin woman in Walsall. Police are treating the attack as racially motivated and are providing full support to the victim. The incident has sparked outrage and calls for justice from community leaders and MPs.

title: AB de Villiers explodes: 'Cockroaches crawl out to attack' — defends Rohit & Kohli
content: Former cricketer AB de Villiers has strongly defended Indian stars Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. He criticized those spreading negativity about the players. De Villiers stated that both cricketers deserve celebration for their contributions. Kohli and Sharma recently silenced critics with strong performances in an ODI series against Australia. Their efforts secured a significant win for India.

title: Gondola cable car project: J&K seeks NIA nod to resume work; halted since Pahalgam attack
content: Jammu and Kashmir government seeks NIA permission for ground surveys for a proposed 1.4km gondola project in Pahalgam, aiming to revive tourism after a recent terrorist attack. The Rs 120 crore project, stalled due to security concerns, will connect Yatri Niwas to Baisaran.  Winter tourism is also being boosted with a ski lift plan.

title: J&K RS poll: Deputy CM accuses BJP of 'stealing' votes; party hits back
content: Allegations of cross-voting rocked the J&K assembly as Deputy CM Surinder Choudhary accused BJP of "stealing four votes" in the recent Rajya Sabha elections. This led to a heated exchange, with NC legislators calling BJP members "vote chor" after the saffron party secured a surprise victory with 32 votes, exceeding its assembly strength.

content: Ole Miss' road win against Oklahoma makes the Rebels a virtual lock for the playoff . deion Sanders summed it up after watching his team give up 587 yards of offense in a 53-7 loss to Utah . "this is probably the worst beating I've ever had except when my momma whooped me as a kid," Sanders said .

title: Follow live: Shohei Ohtani ties things up with solo home run in the seventh
content: After a split north of the border, the  2025 World Series  is headed to Hollywood. The  Los Angeles Dodgers  and  Toronto Blue Jays  each won a game in Canada. Now, a pivotal Game 3 -- with a marquee pitching match between a future Hall of Famer and yet another L.A. ace -- will determine who has the advantage moving forward. We're posting live analysis all game long -- and will add our takeaways after the final pitch. Key links:  World Series schedule, results Gamecast:   Follow the action pitch-by-pitch here

title: Vikings' Wentz to have season-ending surgery
content: wentz will undergo season-ending surgery to repair a left shoulder injury . wentz originally suffered a torn labrum and fractured socket . he is expected to return to the starting lineup for the Vikings' game Sunday at the Detroit Lions .

title: How the FBI says poker games were rigged
content: the case focused on rigged poker games is one of two announced that allegedly involve prominent NBA figures . investigators state that the scheme began in April 2019 when defendant Robert "Black Rob" Stroud and other co-conspirators devised a ruse to use technology to rig illegal poker games against unwitting, wealthy players . in many cases, every other person at the poker table at the same time believed these were "straight" games against other wealthy players.

title: Assam to ban polygamy; proposes at least 7 years in prison - bill on Nov 25
content: Prabin Kalita is a journalist at The Times of India and is currently the Chief of Bureau (northeast). He has been reporting in mainstream Indian national media since 2001. He has been a field journalist reporting gamut of issues from India’s northeastern region and major developments in neighbouring countries like Myanmar, China, Bhutan and Bangladesh concerning India and northeastern region. He has been covering insurgency—internal and cross-border, politics, natural calamities, environment etc. He is a post-graduate in Geological Sciences from Gauhati University. Read More

content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide.
